acceptance-test-run.title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped float values with @PodamFloatValue annotation
acceptance-test-run.name: podamShouldHandleFloatValuesWithThePodamFloatValueAnnotation

test-step.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.FloatValuePojo

Then the Object FloatRangeValuesPojo ( floatFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0.0 floatFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 97.96488 floatFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 892.1976 floatFieldWithPreciseValue = 123456.0 floatObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0.0 floatObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 12.220527 floatObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 29.354637 floatObjectFieldWithPreciseValue = 123456.0 ) should not be null
Then the Float value 0.0 should be greater or equal than 0.0
Then the float value 97.96488 should be lower or equal than 100.0
Then the float value 892.1976 should be between 0.0 and 1000.0
Then the Object 0.0 should not be null
Then the Float value 0.0 should be greater or equal than 0.0
Then the Object 12.220527 should not be null
Then the float value 12.220527 should be lower or equal than 100.0
Then the Object 29.354637 should not be null
Then the float value 29.354637 should be between 0.0 and 1000.0
Then the float value 123456.0 should be precisely 123456.0
Then the Object 123456.0 should not be null
Then the float value 123456.0 should be precisely 123456.0
